derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'provision of help'): from Old French, from late Latin subventio(n-), from Latin subvenire 'assist', from sub- 'from below' + venire 'come'

means.word_mean: 1. grant of financial aid as from a government to an educational institution
2. the act or process of providing aid or help of any sort

sentences.sentence: "The opera tour was subvented by a bank"
